goal_name: A nation that ensures our food and nutrition security needs are adequately met for all people through increasing sustainable food production systems and improving household production
target_name: Reduce reliance on food imports through import substitution for food products that can be produced domestically
GoalDescription: A nation that ensures our food and nutrition security needs are adequately met for all people through increasing sustainable food production systems and improving household production
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Reduce reliance on food imports through import substitution for food products that can be produced domestically
ComputationMethod: The Domestic Food Price Level Index is calculated by dividing the Food Purchasing Power Parity (FPPP) by the General PPP, thus providing an index of the price of food in the country relative to the price of the generic consumption basket
Concept: Consumer food price indices are used by variety of national labour and statistical agencies, as well as large international organisations such as FAO and ILO
Definition: This Indicator is part of the FAO Suite of Food Security indicator in the dimension access.
Dissaggregation: Domestic Market, Municipal Market, Rural/Island/Outer Market, VCMB
Rationale: Domestic food price level index is an important indicator for global monitoring of food security because it compares the relative’s price of food across countries and over time
